page.title: 06COWPLAIN P.D.S.A. CENTRE
page.content: Mr. Hignett, the Senior Veterinary Officer, was interviewed by Hart Plain pupils.He told us that the P.D.S.A. had been running since 1917 and was founded by Maria Dickins. Nobody pays the P.D.S.A. but only people who cannot afford private vet services can come. There are some donation boxes that ask you to please put in as much as you feel is appropriate. They have lots of drugs and medicines for all the different diseases animals can get. At the P.D.S.A. lots of operations are done and they have lots to do because they have about 150 animals a day! There are two special rooms for operations, one is the theatre preparation room for the animals to be checked and prepared before they have an operation and the other room is the actual theatre where the operations are done.
